summary: The measles scripts process outputs from a disease simulation framework to extract, aggregate, and analyze measles‑related mortality data. One script generates summary statistics and visual trends of simulated deaths, while another compares those simulated death counts against external Global Burden of Disease estimates, producing visualizations that highlight any gaps.
business_intent: Enable public‑health analysts and researchers to evaluate the accuracy of measles mortality projections, validate simulation models against established epidemiological benchmarks, and inform intervention planning and policy decisions.
